title: Drawing, Design for Glass-Top Display Case, 1900–05
markings: Watermark across verso bottom : ORIENTAL LINEN
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, upper left, center, and right of design, numerical notations indicating dimensions; at upper right of design with arrow pointing to upper right corner of top: carved; at lower right corner of sheet: ONE IN MAHOGANY - SE[traingle][box]L  $125 / ONE IN SATIN WOOD - SE=EL  $150; at lower right of design with arrow pointing to right leg: BRASS; at center of design below display case top with arrow pointing to right corner of case: inlay
creditline: Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society
description: Rectangular, flat,  glass-top display case with pieces of china inside; raised on 4 straight, tapering legs terminating in brass feet.

participants.person_name: The Lake St. Louis Historical Society

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Design for Glass-Top Display Case, 1900–05. Graphite on thin cream paper. 
Gift of The Lake St. Louis Historical Society. 2000-69-229.
